skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.
skill.summary: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern fronten...

security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill with pre-reviewed sources. A minimal audit found no security issues in the scanned scripts and documentation.

content.value_statement: You need complex Claude artifacts with multiple components and state. This skill generates a modern React workspace and bundles it into one HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Initializes a React and TypeScript Vite project with Node version checks
Installs Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui dependencies, and theme configuration
Adds path aliases in tsconfig and Vite configuration
Extracts prebuilt shadcn/ui components into the project
Bundles the app into a single bundle.html file using Parcel and html-inline
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or later and pnpm, with npm used to install pnpm if missing
Bundling must run from a project root that contains index.html
Generates a full React project and is not intended for single file artifacts
Bundling installs Parcel dependencies and creates a .parcelrc if missing

output: Initialized a Vite React TypeScript project
Installed Tailwind CSS and shadcn components
Configured path aliases and theme tokens
Bundled the app into a single HTML artifact

best_practices: Name the project clearly so the HTML title is meaningful
Verify index.html exists before running the bundle script
Keep components modular to simplify later changes
anti_patterns: Using the skill for simple single file HTML snippets
Running the bundle script outside the project root
Skipping Node version checks and pnpm setup

faq.question: Which environments are compatible?
faq.answer: It runs on Node.js 18 or later with pnpm available, on common shell environments.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It targets complex React artifacts and requires a project directory with index.html.

faq.question: How do I integrate it into my workflow?
faq.answer: Run the init script, build your UI, then bundle and share bundle.html in your tool.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The scripts operate on local files and do not transmit data on their own.

faq.question: What should I do if bundling fails?
faq.answer: Confirm package.json and index.html exist, then rerun the bundle script.

faq.question: How does it compare to simpler skills?
faq.answer: It is heavier but supports React, Tailwind, and shadcn for complex artifacts.
